required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Glucose Monitors to Regulate Glucose Levels in Type 2 Diabetics - (Protocol 3)
clinical_study.official_title: Empowering Medicare Patients to Self-Manage Their Type 2 Diabetes Using Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) - Investigational Device Pilot (SMA Investigational Device)

brief_summary.textblock: This study allows Type 2 diabetics to receive feedback from a continuous glucose monitor (CGM) as part of an educational program designed to help them better manage their glucose levels. Subjects will also wear an activity tracker to monitor their activity and observe its effect on their glucose levels. The educational program will involve calls from coaches to check subjects' progress and answer questions.

primary_outcome.description: (Number of patients who were shipped devices) / (Number of patients invited to enroll) * 100
(Number of patients who complete 10 weeks of CGM) / (Number of patients who received devices) * 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Average of Estimated Glucose Values (EGV)
secondary_outcome.description: (Sum of EGV for a given week) / (Total number of EGV for a given week)
(dosage of Rx on Day 180) - (dosage of Rx on Day 0)

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Age of Participants Who Start Trial (Yrs)
secondary_outcome.description: (Sum of ages of all enrollees) / (Total number of enrollees)

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Age of Participants Who Complete Trial (Yrs)
secondary_outcome.description: (Sum of age of patients who complete) / (Total number who complete)
(Sum of all text messages) / (Total number of participants*days)
(Sum of weekly coaching calls completed) / (Total number of participants*weeks)

arm_group.description: Subjects receive a CGM and activity tracker as part of a educational program to help manage their glucose levels.

intervention.description: Subjects will use a CGM to develop an understanding of how their behaviors influence their glucose levels.
Subjects will use the activity tracker, in combination with a continuous glucose monitor (CGM), to develop an understanding of how their activity levels affect their glucose levels.

Coaches will help subjects understand the readings from the CGMs and how they are affected by diet choices, use of diabetes medications, etc. Coaches and subjects will have weekly conversations about CGM data and behaviors that affect CGM readings. Coaching will occur via telephone, text messaging, and automated text messaging.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be diagnosed with type 2 diabetes
- Be able to read and understand English
- Have access to a telephone
- Have a Medicare Advantage health plan through Senior Dimensions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Blind
- Deaf
- Receiving chemotherapy or radiation to treat cancer (now or in past 6 months)
- Misusing any drugs (including alcohol, painkillers, hallucinogens, or others)
- Critically ill
- Diagnosed with or experiencing:
- Kidney disease stages 4 and 5
- End stage renal disease
- Severe liver disease
- Dementia
- Schizophrenia
- Bipolar disorder
- Autism
- An intellectual or learning disability
- Arrhythmias other than atrial fibrillation
- Congestive heart failure
- Has had a:
- Myocardial infarction within the last 6 months
- Stroke within the last 6 months
- Stroke that resulted in significant disability (e.g., unable to write clearly or walk)

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Diabetes Management Educational Program
group.description: Subjects receive a CGM and activity tracker as part of a educational program to help manage their glucose levels. Continuous Glucose Monitor (CGM): Subjects will use a CGM to develop an understanding of how their behaviors influence their glucose levels. Activity Tracker: Subjects will use the activity tracker, in combination with a continuous glucose monitor (CGM), to develop an understanding of how their activity levels affect their glucose levels. Coaching: Coaches will help subjects understand the readings from the CGMs and how they are affected by diet choices, use of diabetes medications, etc. Coaches and subjects will have weekly conversations about CGM data and behaviors that affect CGM readings. Coaching will occur via telephone, text messaging, and automated text messaging.

Coaching: Coaches will help subjects understand the readings from the CGMs and how they are affected by diet choices, use of diabetes medications, etc. Coaches and subjects will have weekly conversations about CGM data and behaviors that affect CGM readings. Coaching will occur via telephone, text messaging, and automated text messaging.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Program Enrollment Rate (%)
outcome.description: (Number of patients who were shipped devices) / (Number of patients invited to enroll) * 100
outcome.population: Note that the number analyzed is greater than the number of participants (358) because participants are a subset of those who were invited to participate.

outcome.title: Program Completion Rate (%)
outcome.description: (Number of patients who complete 10 weeks of CGM) / (Number of patients who received devices) * 100
outcome.population: Unit of measure, below, should read, "percentage of participants completing 10 weeks of CGM," but there is not enough space.

outcome.title: Weekly Average of Estimated Glucose Values (EGV)
outcome.description: (Sum of EGV for a given week) / (Total number of EGV for a given week)
outcome.population: 358 Participants started the study, but participants dropped out as time passed. By week 10, there were only 193 participants remaining who were providing EGV.

outcome.title: Change in Medication Dosage (mg/Day; U/Day)
outcome.description: (dosage of Rx on Day 180) - (dosage of Rx on Day 0)
outcome.population: After starting the study, administrator realized that it would not be able to obtain medication data from participants. There is no data to report for this measure.

outcome.title: Average Age of Participants Who Start Trial (Yrs)
outcome.description: (Sum of ages of all enrollees) / (Total number of enrollees)
outcome.population: Two of the 358 participants who started the study lacked age data.

event.sub_title: Death from artherosclerotic and hypertensive heart disease

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
